results.title: Sale by sample
results.brief_description: This film shows the wool-store operations associated with sale by sample. All operations are clearly shown from receival, the sampling line, and cataloguing to the auction sale. The “close-ups” of the sampling line and the mechanical handling in a single-level wool-store are extremely informative. The commentary is very clear and adequately describes the salient points. The film is recommended for wool-classing at an advanced level. No credits available.

results.title: Sailors in the making
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Australia. Royal Australian Navy. Public Relations
results.brief_description: The training of recruits at the Flinders Naval Depot. Basic training given to all recruits in seamanship, fire-fighting and damage control. The training ships and the facilities of the Depot for self-improvement - library, common room, theatre, chapels, sport. Some of the thirteen special schools - naval gunnery, electrical, engineering and advanced seamanship.

results.title: Sailing fundamentals. Part 2. Rules and tactics
results.brief_description: Aimed at people who are just starting to sail competitively. Explains the effects of wind shadows and their application to tactics such as lee-bowing. The viewers are then taken around a typical racing course, highlighting the essential rules and tactics with the use of animation and “on board” camera work. Narrated by Clive Hearne.

results.title: Sailing
results.brief_description: The pleasures of sailing in smaller craft. Different types of sailing dinghies, yachts and canoes in action; the prowess of enthusiasts enjoying this popular sport at many locations in Britain. Closing sequences show HRH the Duke of Edinburgh at the annual Cowes Regatta.

results.title: Saharan venture
results.creator_credit: Harry Woof and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Story of introduction of natural gas to the United Kingdom from Algeria ending dependence on coal. Covers development of fuel tanker designed for ocean transportation of natural gas in 1957 (Methane Pioneer) to arrival of the Methane Princess on October 12th 1964 with first delivery of natural gas to the United Kingdom.

results.title: Saga in stone
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Glimpses of a few of the sculptures which made famous the craftsmanship of Indian artists. Among the examples illustrated are the temples of Konarak in Orissa; one of the noblest monuments that man has raised to the Sun God, the Shrine of Kalugumalai carved out of a single rock; the Domambullar in Pudukotah State; the ruins of Hampi in the South; a relic of the Vijayanagar Kingdom, and the shrines at Khajuraho in Central India.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Safety with small craft
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris and Southern Films
results.brief_description: Outlines commonsense safety rules to be followed on rivers, lakes and the sea by water skiers, fishermen, skin-divers, and yachtsmen. Rules regarding life-jackets, giving way, speed limits, and fuelling procedures are illustrated. Suggests simple precautions to be taken by power boat owners to ensure safety.
